synthesis_conditions.procedure: A solution of ZnII(hfac)2･2H2O and bisPyTM dissolved in dry CHCl3 was slowly evaporated under a n-hexane atmosphere. The obtained red crystals of bisZn were washed with n-hexane, dried in vacuo.

under_magnetic_field.system_description: The system consists of a picosecond diode laser with the emission wavelength of 375 nm as light source, a single grating spectrometer, and a multichannel CCD detector combined with a solenoid type superconducting magnet, which can generate up to 15 or 18 T.
under_magnetic_field.sample_preparation: Optical fibers are used to lead a light from light sources to a sample at the center of the superconducting magnet and from the sample to the spectrometer.

luminescent_quantum_yields_measurement.method_description: Absolute emission quantum yields of bisPyTM and bisZn at 79 K in the emission wavelength range of 500 to 800 nm was measured using a JASCO FP8500 spectrometer equipped with an ILFC-847 liquid N2 cooled integrating sphere.

trisZn.procedure: Emission spectra of trisZn was monitored with continuous excitation at 375 nm light (5MHz, tune value: 25%) for 12 hours.
trisZn.results: The emission intensity and spectra before and after irradiation showed that trisZn is stable under light irradiation at 4.2 K.
